, Eric Schmidt , Larry Page and co-founder Sergey Brin lavished ebullient praise on one another. " Eric Schmidt has clearly done an outstanding job," Larry Page said. A few moments later, Eric Schmidt sent out a peppy little tweet, Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! But surely there's more to the story. The company itself shrouded the transition in familiar corporate speak, calling it a move to "streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability.

" . As Google's new chief executive, Larry Page will lead product development and technology strategy, along with all day-to-day operations of the firm. Sergey Brin , who co-founded Google with Larry Page , will devote his time and energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products . His title will remain co-founder. In a blog post, Eric Schmidt said that he had been working with Larry Page and Sergey Brin on ways to simplify Google's management structure and quicken decision making.

But he now lives in the 11th District again and is registered to vote there, according to 2010 campaign spokesman Bill Lockyer Maxfield. Obviously, no one knows what the outcome of redistricting will be, though there has been significant coverage of the idea that districts should reflect communities of interest, Maxfield said. Joe Simitian , meanwhile, filed a Statement of Intention to run in 2012 for the 21st Assembly District seat won in November by freshman lawmaker Rich Gordon , D-Menlo Park.
